item.title: CLM add a quote by H. A. Rey
item.description: "Now run along and play, but don't get into trouble.' George promised to be good. But it is easy for little monkeys to forget." -- H. A. Rey

item.title: CLM add a quote by Edward Eager
item.description:
"The best kind of book," said Barnaby, "is a magic book."
"Naturally," said John." -- Edward Eager

item.title: CLM add a quote by Elizabeth Marie Pope
item.description: "A gentleman can hardly continue to sit,' he explained, in his serenest and most level voice, 'when he asks a very remarkable young lady to do him the honor of marrying him. And - 'he somehow contrived to grin at me wickedly, 'I usually get what I want, Miss Grahame,' he added, and pitched over in a tangled heap on the floor." -- Elizabeth Marie Pope

item.title: CLM add a quote by K.M. Peyton
item.description: "Life was like that. Everyone loved the wrong person who loved someone else or didnâ€™t love at all." -- K.M. Peyton

item.title: CLM add a quote by Lucy Maud Montgomery
item.description: "When I read that the flash came, and I took a sheet of paper. . .and I wrote on it: I, Emily Byrd Starr, do solemnly vow this day that I will climb the Alpine Path and write my name on the scroll of fame." -- Lucy Maud Montgomery

item.title: CLM add a quote by Anne Stuart
item.description: "She tried to allow herself only one biting remark an hour, and she had already overstepped her allowance." -- Anne Stuart

item.title: CLM add a quote by Arthur Ransome
item.description: "Better drowned than duffers, if not duffers won't drown." -- Arthur Ransome

item.title: CLM add a quote by Sherwood Smith,
item.description: "A wager?" I repeated. "Yes," he said, and gave me a slow smile, bright with challenge. ... "Stake?" I asked cautiously. He was still smiling, an odd sort of smile, hard to define. "A kiss." My first reaction was outrage, but then I remembered that I was on my way to Court, and that had to be the kind of thing they did at Court. And if I win I don't have to collect. I hesitated only a moment longer, lured by the thought of open sky, and speed, and winning. "Done," I said." -- Sherwood Smith,

item.title: CLM add a quote by Betty MacDonald
item.description: "I'll do it because I want to but not because you tell me to!" -- Betty MacDonald

item.title: CLM add a quote by Sarah Dessen
item.description: "There is never a time or place for true love. It happens accidentally, in a heartbeat, in a single flashing, throbbing moment." -- Sarah Dessen

item.title: CLM add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Muster your wits; stand in your own defence..." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: CLM add a quote by Duane Decker
item.description: "A no-hitter is a freaky thing,' Tweet said. 'Most of the greatest pitchers never pitched one. It's a combination of a lot of little accidents." -- Duane Decker

item.title: CLM add a quote by Maud Hart Lovelace
item.description: "She thought of the library, so shining white and new; the rows and rows of unread books; the bliss of unhurried sojourns there and of going out to a restaurant, alone, to eat." -- Maud Hart Lovelace

item.title: CLM add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "She generally gave herself very good advice, (though she very seldom followed it)." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: CLM add a quote by Pamela Belle
item.description: "I have several people among my acquaintances who might be described as 'fearsome rogues.' Did he give a name?" -- Pamela Belle

item.title: CLM add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: CLM add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Elinor agreed with it all, for she did not think he deserved the compliment of rational opposition." -- Jane Austen

item.title: CLM add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "She is too fond of books, and it has turned her brain." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: CLM add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "Jo's eyes sparkled, for it's always pleasant to be believed in; and a friend's praise is always sweeter than a dozen newspaper puffs." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: CLM add a quote by Sherwood Smith
item.description: "Finally someone takes me seriously enough to ask for my word of honor, and itâ€™s a villain." -- Sherwood Smith

item.title: CLM add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I declare after all there is no enjoyment like reading! How much sooner one tires of any thing than of a book! -- When I have a house of my own, I shall be miserable if I have not an excellent library." -- Jane Austen

item.title: CLM add a quote by Lucy Maud Montgomery
item.description: "Miss Barry was a kindred spirit after all," Anne confided to Marilla, "You wouldn't think so to look at her, but she is. . . Kindred spirits are not so scarce as I used to think. It's splendid to find out there are so many of them in the world." -- Lucy Maud Montgomery

item.title: CLM add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "But I donâ€™t want to go among mad people," Alice remarked. "Oh, you canâ€™t help that," said the Cat: "weâ€™re all mad here. Iâ€™m mad. Youâ€™re mad." "How do you know Iâ€™m mad?" said Alice. "You must be," said the Cat, or you wouldnâ€™t have come here." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: CLM add a quote by Daphne du Maurier
item.description: "If only there could be an invention that bottled up a memory, like scent. And it never faded, and it never got stale. And then, when one wanted it, the bottle could be uncorked, and it would be like living the moment all over again." -- Daphne du Maurier

item.title: CLM add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: CLM add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I am almost inclined to set it up as a canon that a children's story which is enjoyed only by children is a bad children's story." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: CLM add a quote by Patricia Wentworth
item.description: "Her name is Maud Silver. Louisa says she has solved many difficult cases besides being an extremely expert knitter." -- Patricia Wentworth

item.title: CLM add a quote by Hilda Lewis
item.description: "Earth and fire and water and air We solemnly promise, we solemnly swear Not a word, not a hint, not a sound to declare Earth and fire and water and air!" -- Hilda Lewis

item.title: CLM add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "It was one of those cases where you approve the broad, general principle of an idea but can't help being in a bit of a twitter at the prospect of putting it into practical effect. I explained this to Jeeves, and he said much the same thing had bothered Hamlet." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: CLM add a quote by Eva Ibbotson
item.description: "Slowly, Anna put up a hand to his muzzle and began to scratch that spot behind the ear where large dogs keep their souls." -- Eva Ibbotson
